business.headline: Nifty falls for 10th straight day, longest daily losing streak since 1996 launchNifty has registered a 10-day losing streak amid multiple triggers, including relentless selling by foreign investors and fears of an escalating trade war.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as trade war fears keep investors on edgeThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 96.01 points lower at 72,989.93 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 36.65 points to 22,082.65.

Stock market correction: Here's how to pick quality stocksDuring a market downturn, investors must be careful about stock selection. Choosing the right stocks can help minimise losses and create long-term gains.
Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal wants weekly updates from staff: ReportUnder the new policy, employees must send a short email every week highlighting 3-5 key tasks they have completed.
Explained: Why popular cryptocurrencies are crashing suddenlyOver the last 24 hours, Bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, has lost 8.83%, currently trading at $83,461.02.

IPOs in hibernation mode: Why have public listings dried up?The last mainboard IPO to open for subscription was Quality Power on February 14, 2025. Since then, there has been no fresh activity in the public listing space.
Microchip to cut 2,000 jobs, impacting 9% of global workforceMicrochip has reported five straight quarters of declining sales, with fourth-quarter revenue and profits falling below expectations.

Mixue, China's bubble tea giant, makes a strong IPO debut with 47% stock jumpMixue, popular for its low-cost drinks and Snow King mascot, generated $444 million by offering 17 million shares at HK$202.5 each.

Nifty stares at worst monthly losing streak. Can March turn the tide?If the situation does not improve in March, Nifty could fall for the sixth straight month, something that has never happened before. This could have a drastic impact on investor sentiments and make the situation worse.

Oyo races to launch IPO as debt repayment deadline approaches: ReportOyo has been flirting with an IPO for years, but Covid-19 wrecked its earlier ambitions. Now, the hotel chain is talking to bankers again, targeting a valuation of up to $5 billion, according to sources.
Citigroup employee's error almost cost the bank $6 billion. Here's what happenedThe said error occurred during an attempted transfer of funds between the bank's internal accounts.

Trump's tariffs spark trade war: Will global economy pay a heavy price?Financial experts have warned that Donald Trump's tariffs could ignite a global trade war, disrupting supply chains and jeopardizing international trade flows built over decades.

entertainment.headline: Shonali Bose on DU, Miranda House's objection to Ziddi Girls: It was heartbreakingPrime Video's Ziddi Girls faced backlash from sections of Delhi University and Miranda House students over perceived negative portrayal, but director Shonali Bose clarifies the trailer was misunderstood and most students ultimately enjoyed the show.

Anora OTT release: When and where to watch the Oscar-winning Best FilmThe Oscar-winning film 'Anora' is set to stream on JioHotstar from March 17. Directed by Sean Baker and starring Mikey Madison, who won Best Actress, the movie offers a thought-provoking narrative.
Singer Dolly Parton's husband Carl Dean dies at 82Carl Dean, husband of Dolly Parton and inspiration for her hit song, Jolene, has died at the age of 82.

Blackpink's Lisa on her new album Alter Ego: Want people to feel empoweredLisa of Blackpink recently spoke about her new solo album, Alter Ego. In a virtual panel discussion, the singer shared her desire to make listeners feel empowered with her new album.

Taarak Mehta actor Deepti Sadhwani turns showstopper at Milan Fashion WeekTaarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah actor Deepti Sadhwani turned showstopper at Milan Fashion Week. The actor shared stunning photos from her rampwalk.

Kaam Idhar Udhar Hogaya: YouTuber Ashish Chanchlani on India's Got Latent rowYouTuber Ashish Chanchlani got emotional in his first video after his appearance on comedian Samay Raina's India's Got Latent show.

Maharani 4 teaser: Huma Qureshi returns as Rani Bharti to safeguard BiharActor Huma Qureshi is set to return as Rani Bharti in Maharani Season 4. The makers announced the news with the teaser of the upcoming gripping series.

TV show Tenali Rama set catches fire, shoot haltedA fire broke out on the set of TV show Tenali Rama due to a generator malfunction, halting production. There were no casualties, but the set suffered damage and repairs are underway.

Be Happy: Abhishek Bachchan reunites with Ludo co-actor Inayat in feel-good filmThe trailer of Abhishek Bachchan and Inayat Verma's upcoming dance-drama Be Happy was released today. Directed by Remo D'Souza, the heartfelt film will premiere on Prime Video on March 14.

BTS' J-hope's Seoul concert: New song, fan proposal and special appearance by JinBTS member and rapper J-hope recently held a concert in Seoul which was attended by his close friend and singer Kim Seokjin (Jin). The concert was one big event for the fans as it consisted of many other surprises besides the central performance by the artiste.

Khakee The Bengal Chapter: Jeet and Prosenjit announce release date with fun clipThe next installment of Netflix's critically acclaimed thriller series Khakee, Khakee: The Bengal Chapter will premiere on Netflix in March. The makers of the show announced its release date with a fun video.

Anupamaa actor Sudhanshu Pandey breaks silence on rumoured feud with Rupali GangulyActor Sudhanshu Pandey has addressed the ongoing rumours about a feud with his Anupamaa co-star Rupali Ganguly. In an interview, he clarified the situation and dismissed the speculations.

general news.headline: Punjab can't be 'dharna' state: Bhagwant Mann as farmers detained ahead of stirShedding light on why he stormed out of the meeting "without provocation," Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann revealed that he had asked farmers to call off the strikes, stating that the state could not be held to ransom.

Beat the s*** out of that doctor: US man after assaulting Indian-origin nurseThe Florida hospital patient who brutally attacked an Indian-origin nurse admitted to the hate crime, reported local law enforcement. The attacker was reported to have said, "Indians are bad. I just beat the s*** out of an Indian doctor," sparking outrage and calls for stricter protections.

Bajinder Singh: Punjab's 'Yashu, Yashu' pastor who found Christ in jailHailed as a miracle healer with millions following him online and offline, self-proclaimed Christian prophet pastor Bajinder Singh has been charged with sexual harassment and criminal intimidation. While his viral sermons, reels with 'Mera Yashu Yashu' song and celebrity endorsements have built his fame, he has a history of controversies.

UP Assembly Speaker says MLA spat paan masala inside hall, he got it cleanedAn MLA allegedly spat paan masala on the carpet of the Uttar Pradesh Assembly, inviting a strong rebuke from the Speaker, who urged members to maintain the dignity of the House.

Video: Speeding BMW loses control, crashes into barrier on Mumbai's Coastal RoadA high-speed crash on Mumbai's Coastal Road involved a 24-year-old Juhu resident losing control of his BMW. A video of the accident was widely shared on social media, and a case has since been registered against him.

Remove Aurangzeb's grave from Maharashtra: BJP's Navneet Rana steps up attackSamajwadi Party's Abu Azmi sparked controversy on Monday by praising Mughal emperor Aurangzeb, contradicting historical accounts. His statements claimed Aurangzeb built temples and was not cruel.

Calling someone 'Miyan-Tiyan' in poor taste, but not an offence: Supreme CourtThe Supreme Court ruled that calling someone "Miyan-Tiyan" or 'Pakistani' is inappropriate but not a criminal offence under Section 298, as it doesn't meet the legal threshold for hurting religious sentiments.
Ukraine hits back after US pauses aid: Trump pushing us to accept Russia's demandsThe Ukranian government has strongly condemned America's decision to pause military aid to Ukraine.

Video: PM Modi plays with orangutan, feeds lion cub at Vantara animal shelterIn a video, the Prime Minister was seen closely interacting and spending time with various species of animals which have been rehabilitated there.

Punish Zelenskyy and reward Putin - Is this Trump's peace plan?Donald Trump, who had promised that he would end the war between Russia and Ukraine even before he becomes President, is still struggling to come up with a peace plan.

Wrestler Sushil Kumar granted bail by Delhi High Court in murder caseDelhi High Court granted bail to Olympian Sushil Kumar, a main accused in the murder of a junior wrestler. The two-time Olympic medallist was arrested by the Delhi police in May 2021.

Trump's address to US Congress won't be called State of the Union. Here's whyDonald Trump's address a joint session of Congress on Tuesday night, his first since returning to the White House in January, will not be the State of the Union address since the US President was inaugurated over a month ago.

Pepsi's 'Anytime' ad takes on Coca-Cola's 'Halftime'. Are cola wars back?After Coca-Cola launched its 'Halftime' campaign for the ICC Champions Trophy, Pepsi fired back with a witty response. The internet is asking if the cola wars are back again? Here's all about it.
Big sea snafu brewing in KeralaAn amendment bill that has given the Centre control over Kerala's coastal waters faces fierce resistance from people and politicians across party lines

Maharashtra minister resigns after aide arrested in sarpanch murder caseMoments after Dhananjay Munde's resignation, the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader broke his silence and stated that he had stepped down due to health reasons as well, while condemning the brutal murder of the village headman of Massajog.

China, Canada, Mexico retaliate after Trump's trade tariffs: Have plan B, C, DCanada and Mexico have launched retaliatory tariffs after President Donald Trump confirmed sweeping trade measures starting Tuesday, escalating North American tensions. Markets reacted sharply, with the S&P 500 index dropping 2 per cent in afternoon trading on Monday.

Study, stress, repeat: How 10-hour school days push Asian students to the limitIndians are not the only ones making children attend school and study-related activities for long hours. Here are the top 10 countries with the longest school hours. But why do Asian countries top the list?

Congress MLA refuses to accept Rashmika's statement, doubles down on criticismCongress MLA Ravi Ganiga who earlier criticised actor Rashmika Mandanna for allegedly declining an invitation to the Bengaluru International Film Festival, dismissed her statement denying the refusal.

Congress leader hits back amid fat-shaming row, cites Kangana Ranaut's old tweetCongress spokesperson Shama Mohamed pulled up an old tweet by BJP MP Kangana Ranaut, in which the Bollywood actor's now-deleted tweet, bashing Rohit Sharma for his stand on the farmers' protests back in 2021.

Manusmriti, Baburnama to be dropped from Delhi University history syllabusDelhi University has withdrawn the proposal to include Manusmriti and Baburnama in the undergraduate history syllabus after opposition from faculty members, with the Vice Chancellor saying DU won't allow divisive content.

Waterfalls to sunsets, Suhana Khan shares pics from girls trip to BaliActor Suhana Khan recently shared glimpses from her Bali vacation with friend Jasmine on Instagram. Meanwhile, she is set to debut in Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film King.
Citigroup employee's error almost cost the bank $6 billion. Here's what happenedThe said error occurred during an attempted transfer of funds between the bank's internal accounts.

Army on alert as Bangladesh deploys Turkish drones near borderIndia is closely monitoring Bangladesh's deployment of Turkish Bayraktar TB2 drones near its border, amid growing military ties between Dhaka, Turkey, and Pakistan. Indian agencies have intensified surveillance, citing security concerns.

2 men force Pune teen to get intimate with uncle, then take turns raping herTwo men allegedly raped and robbed a 19-year-old woman at a knifepoint in front of her maternal uncle after forcing them to get intimate and recording the act in Maharashtra's Pune.

Chris Rock reacts to returning as Oscars host after slapgateActor and comedian Chris Rock, who has previously hosted Oscars, has not completely ruled out hosting the upcoming Academy Awards. Rock had previously been at the centre of a controversy after he had been slapped by actor Will Smith at a previous Oscar event.

Ralph Fiennes' Oscar snub: Voters mistakenly believed he had already wonRalph Fiennes was overlooked at the 97th Oscars as voters mistakenly believed he already had an Oscar for Schindler's List. Adrien Brody, who actually owns an Oscar, was chosen instead.

Jr NTR-Prashanth Neel's Dragon will work beyond expectations, says producerDuring a recent event, producer Y Ravi Shankar of Mythri Movie Makers revealed details about Prashanth Neel's directorial Dragon, which stars Jr NTR in the lead.

Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR begin dance-off shoot for War 2: ReportThe highly anticipated spy thriller War 2, starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR, is in its final stages of production. The team reportedly started shooting an electrifying dance number, bringing together two of Indian cinema's finest dancers.

sports.headline: Babar, Rizwan dropped from Pakistan T20I squad for New Zealand tourChampions Trophy 2025: Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan have been left out of Pakistan's squad for the T20I series against New Zealand. Pakistan also named their ODI squad and retained Rizwan as their captain.

Varun Chakravarthy a national treasure: Fans after Head's wicketVarun Chakravarthy sent Indian fans into a frenzy after dismissing Australia's Travis Head in the Champions Trophy semi-final, continuing his red-hot form and giving India a crucial breakthrough early in the high-stakes clash in Dubai.
Watch: Varun Chakravarthy cures India's 'Head-ache'India wrist spinner Varun Chakravarthy got the big wicket of Travis Head in the semi-final of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025  in Dubai.

Indian team sport black armbands to pay respect to Padmakar ShivalkarThe Indian team paid their respects to the late great Padmakar Shivalkar by wearing black armbands for the semi-final against Australia on Tuesday, March 4. Shivalkar passed away on March 3 at the age of 84.

Rohit Sharma nears world record for losing toss, memes go viral India vs Australia semifinal: The rub of green did not go Rohit Sharma's way as the India captain lost the toss for the 11th successive time. Steve Smith, Australia's stand-in captain, opted to bat on a sluggish pitch in Dubai.

Australia add 2 extra spinners to support Adam Zampa vs IndiaAustralia have stacked their Playing XI with spin options for the Champions Trophy semi-final against India, bringing in Cooper Connolly and Tanveer Sangha to partner Adam Zampa, as they look to counter Dubai's spin-friendly conditions.

IND vs AUS: Varun Chakravarthy retains spot as India go with 4 spinnersIndia have decided to stick with the four spinners mantra as Varun Chakravarthy retained his spot in the playing XI for the semi-final against Australia in Dubai on Tuesday, March 4.

Rohit must win toss vs Australia: Aakash Chopra on India's semi-finalAakash Chopra believes India winning the toss in their Champions Trophy semi-final against Australia could be decisive, as Rohit Sharma's luck with the coin continues to be a concern ahead of the crucial knockout clash in Dubai.

94 bids, 36,100 USD: Magnus Carlsen's 'Jeansgate' denims gets sold on eBayMagnus Carlsen's infamous 'Jeangate' denims sold for a whopping 36,100 dollars on eBay. Carlsen put the jeans for auction in February this year and the proceedings went to a charity.

India vs Travis Head, not Australia: Fans start meme fest ahead of semi-finalAs India prepare for their Champions Trophy semi-final against Australia, fans are once again wary of Travis Head's threat. Memes and discussions highlight concerns over Head's past dominance, making his wicket a crucial target for India.

IND vs AUS: Varun Chakravarthy retains spot as India go with 4 spinnersIndia have decided to stick with the four spinners mantra as Varun Chakravarthy retained his spot in the playing XI for the semi-final against Australia in Dubai on Tuesday, March 4.

Rohit must win toss vs Australia: Aakash Chopra on India's semi-finalAakash Chopra believes India winning the toss in their Champions Trophy semi-final against Australia could be decisive, as Rohit Sharma's luck with the coin continues to be a concern ahead of the crucial knockout clash in Dubai.

India vs Travis Head, not Australia: Fans start meme fest ahead of semi-finalAs India prepare for their Champions Trophy semi-final against Australia, fans are once again wary of Travis Head's threat. Memes and discussions highlight concerns over Head's past dominance, making his wicket a crucial target for India.

Change jersey colour? Aakash Chopra's hilarious take on stopping Travis HeadAakash Chopra joked that India may have to change their jersey colour from blue to stop Travis Head ahead of the semi-final on Tuesday, March 4. Head has tormented India in the recent past by scoring big hundreds in ICC events.

Ravi Shastri suggests India to go with unchanged XI for semi-final Champions Trophy 2025: Ravi Shastri said that India should go in with the same playing for the semi-final against Australia after beating New Zealand in their last Group match on Sunday.

Ricky Ponting wants IPL 2024-mode Jake Fraser-McGurk in semi-final vs IndiaRicky Ponting has urged Jake Fraser-McGurk to replicate his IPL 2024 form as Australia face India in the Champions Trophy semi-final. With Matthew Short ruled out, Fraser-McGurk's place in the playing XI remains a key decision.

Axar Patel could be India's trump card for Champions Trophy knockout stageAxar Patel has emerged as India's game-changer in the Champions Trophy, delivering match-winning performances with both bat and ball. As India gear up for their semi-final against Australia, his impact could be the defining factor.

India has psychological advantage vs Australia in semis: GavaskarSunil Gavaskar feels that India will have a psychological advantage over Australia in the semi-final on Tuesday, March 4. India have won all their matches that they have played in Dubai so far.

All the pressure on India in semi-final clash, none on Australia: Brad HaddinFormer wicketkeeper Brad Haddin has claimed that all the pressure will be on India in the semi-final against Australia. Haddin also said that Australia won't have any pressure on them and feels that they can beat India in Dubai.

No 'silencing' talk: Steve Smith breaks from Cummins' playbook Champions Trophy Semi-Final: Australia captain Steve Smith was reminded of Pat Cummins' famous words from the 2023 World Cup final as he addressed the press on Monday in Dubai. Smith will lead Australia against tournament favorites India in what promises to be a thrilling semi-final.

India's spin overload vindicated as team lays out Varun trapIndia's move to play four spinners against New Zealand worked like a dream in their final group-stage match in the Champions Trophy. Mystery spinner Varun Chakravarthy stole the show in his very first outing at the tournament. And that begs the question: Should India continue with the same template in the semi-final match as well?

India has psychological advantage vs Australia in semis: GavaskarSunil Gavaskar feels that India will have a psychological advantage over Australia in the semi-final on Tuesday, March 4. India have won all their matches that they have played in Dubai so far.

All the pressure on India in semi-final clash, none on Australia: Brad HaddinFormer wicketkeeper Brad Haddin has claimed that all the pressure will be on India in the semi-final against Australia. Haddin also said that Australia won't have any pressure on them and feels that they can beat India in Dubai.

No 'silencing' talk: Steve Smith breaks from Cummins' playbook Champions Trophy Semi-Final: Australia captain Steve Smith was reminded of Pat Cummins' famous words from the 2023 World Cup final as he addressed the press on Monday in Dubai. Smith will lead Australia against tournament favorites India in what promises to be a thrilling semi-final.

India's spin overload vindicated as team lays out Varun trapIndia's move to play four spinners against New Zealand worked like a dream in their final group-stage match in the Champions Trophy. Mystery spinner Varun Chakravarthy stole the show in his very first outing at the tournament. And that begs the question: Should India continue with the same template in the semi-final match as well?

India's mental block is more against Travis Head than Australia: Dinesh KarthikDinesh Karthik feels that India's mental block in knockout games has been more against Travis Head than Australia as a team. Head has tormented India in the recent past with big knocks in ICC finals.

Should Rohit Sharma curb his aggression in semis? Manjrekar, Kumble weigh inChampions Trophy 2025: Sanjay Manjrekar and Anil Kumble said that Rohit Sharma should try and play a long innings and give India a good start in the semi-final against Steve Smith's Australia.

India should be wary of Australia! Real Madrid of cricket can't be discounted It's time for another India vs Australia clash in a major ICC event as both teams renew their rivalry in the Champions Trophy. While the Aussies maybe depleted and struck by injuries, their winning mentality, much like Real Madrid in football, could help them against India.

No matter what, you will bat at No. 5: Axar earns Rohit Sharma's faithChampions Trophy 2025: Indian skipper Rohit Sharma said that Axar Patel has improved his batting significantly, prompting the team management to send him at No.5 in the lineup.

Semifinal LIVE: Jadeja double hurts Australia after Smith fiftyChampions Trophy semifinal, India (IND) vs Australia (AUS) Live Updates: Ravindra Jadeja is pulling things back for India. With quick wickets of Marnus Labuschagne and Josh Inglis, he has put the pressure back on Australia. Alex Carey has joined Steve Smith, who is playing a captain's knock with a solid fifty.

Can Varun Chakravarthy cure India's 'Head-ache' to avenge Ahmedabad heartbreak?India are about to have a face-off with their old nemesis Travis Head as they lock horns with Australia in the semi-final of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Having failed to find a cure to their 'Head-ache' over the past few years, could Varun Chakravarthy finally help India end their misery and script a fairytale redemption in Dubai?

With Dubai edge, India aim to clear familiar Aussie hurdleIndia vs Australia, semi-final preview: India head into the Champions Trophy knockout game as favourites, backed by form and familiar conditions in Dubai. But despite missing key players, Australia remain a formidable knockout force, ready to challenge once again.

Beth Mooney, bowlers star as Gujarat Giants thrash UP Warriorz by 81 runsGujarat Giants beat UP Warriorz by 81 runs in Match 15 of the Women's Premier League 2025 (WPL 2025). Beth Mooney was adjudged Player of the Match for her whirlwind innings of 96* (59).

Rohit Sharma's bat does the talking. Cricket isn't a modelling contestCongress spokesperson Shama Mohamed fat-shaming Rohit Sharma and calling him an unimpressive captain shows her lack of understanding of the sport. Rohit's fitness, records, and leadership speak for themselves. Cricket isn't a modelling contest.

IND vs AUS semi-final predicted XIs: Will Australia mimic spin-heavy India?India and Australia are all set to lock horns in the semi-final of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Both captains are likely to scratch their heads while finalising the ideal playing XI for the all-important fixture.

I couldn't run 2 laps but could bat all day: Sunil Gavaskar on Rohit's fitness rowChampions Trophy 2025: Speaking to India Today, legendary Sunil Gavaskar revealed that he was unable to run two laps around the cricket ground during his playing days due to shin splints, arguing that cricket fitness and physical fitness can be two different things.

Steve Smith warns India of 'good aggression' from Travis Head Champions Trophy semi-final: Steve Smith, speaking to the press ahead of the game against India, said he is hopeful of another big show from Travis Head. Smith shed light on the nature of pitch in Dubai, but remained tight-lipped about whether Australia would play an extra specialist spinner.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
